DataElement.preferredName: Evaluable Patient RECIST Version Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for patients whose response to treatment can be measured by a version of RECIST as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Evaluable Patient Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Version Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Patients whose response to a treatment can be measured because enough information has been collected._Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)_A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Patients whose response to a treatment can be measured because enough information has been collected.

Concepts.definition: Patients whose response to a treatment can be measured because enough information has been collected.

Property.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Version Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com):A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.longName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
